japanese:
よう。
さっそく、ここへ来てたのか。
translation:
Hey.
You come here right away?

japanese:
あら？
上杉君もアイスを食べに来たのですか？
translation:
Oh?
Did you also come to eat ice cream, Uesugi-kun?

japanese:
まあ、そんなところだ。
なんたって、お前ら全員のお勧めだったしな。
translation:
Well, that's how it is.
After all, it was recommended by all of you.

japanese: それなのに、来てるのは２人だけなのか。
translation: And yet, only two of you came.

japanese:
ええ。
途中で気になる場所があったらしく、
そちらを先に見てくると言っていました。
translation:
Yes.
The rest said they had a place they were curious about
on the way and went to check it out first.

japanese:
（真っ先にここへ来そうなのは五月。
　あと二乃もスイーツ関連は好きそうだし……
　その２人って可能性もあるな）
translation:
(Itsuki would be the one who would come here first.
 Nino also seems to like sweets...
 There's a possibility it could be those two.)

japanese:
それで？
ここのアイスはそんなに有名なのか？
translation: So, is the ice cream here that famous?

japanese:
沖縄の定番アイスクリームと言えば、
ここのもので決まりですから。
translation:
When it comes to classic Okinawan ice cream,
this is the place to go.

japanese:
１年を通して暖かい沖縄では、
アイスクリームも人気なのかもしれませんね。
translation:
Ice cream is probably really popular in Okinawa 
since it's warm all year round, ya know?

japanese:
ちなみにここのアイスは、
地元産のフルーツを使っているのが売りなんです！
translation:
By the way, the selling point
of this ice cream
is that it uses locally produced fruits!

japanese:
ほら、見てください！
どれも美味しそうですよ？
translation:
Please, take a look!
All of them look delicious, don't they?

japanese:
定番のものから期間限定のフレーバーまで
揃っていますね……。
translation:
They have everything from the classic flavors
to limited-time flavors...

japanese: うう、種類が多すぎて悩ましいですっ！
translation: Oh, there are too many flavors to choose from!

japanese:
売りだっていう
地元産フルーツを使ってるのはどのあたりなんだ？
translation:
Where do they get the locally produced fruits
that they advertise?

japanese:
パッションフルーツや
シークヮーサーなどがそうですね。
translation:
Passion fruit and
shikuwasa citrus fruit are some of them.

japanese:
ああ、シークヮーサーは有名だな。
昨日、一花もシークヮーサーのなんかを飲んでたし。
translation:
Yeah, shikuwasa is famous.
Yesterday, Ichika was drinking something with shikuwasa.

japanese: それであれば、味も想像できるのでは？
translation: If that's the case, can you imagine the taste?

japanese:
いや別に、俺は飲んでないからな？
どんな味かなんてわからねぇし。
translation:
Well, I didn't try it or anything.
So, I don't know what it tastes like.

japanese:
果物だけではなく、塩ちんすこう味や
さとうきび味なんてものまでありますね。
translation:
There are more than just fruit flavors,
but also salted chinsuko biscuit and sugar cane.

japanese:
なんだそりゃ？
もはや、どんな味なのか想像できねぇな。
translation:
Woah, no way?
I can't even imagine what that would taste like.

japanese:
これだけ種類があれば、
上杉君の気に入る味も見つかりますよ。
translation:
With this many options,
you'll surely find a flavor you'll like,
Uesugi-kun.

japanese: 色々と食べてみてはどうです？
translation: Why don't you try a variety of them?

japanese:
色々って。
お前らはどんだけ食べるつもりなんだ。
translation:
What do you mean by 'a variety'?
How much are you guys planning on eating?

japanese:
そうですね。
私はダブル――
translation:
Let's see.
I'll have a double%p-2;――

japanese:
いえ、これだけ種類があるのですし、
ここはトリプルですね。
translation:
No, with this many different kinds,
I might go for a triple-scoop.

japanese:
３段重ねってことか？
これだからセレブは……。
translation:
A three-tier sort of thing?
Rich folk, really...

japanese: これくらい普通では？
translation: This much is normal, isn't it?

japanese:
それに、やはり沖縄の限定商品は食べておかないと。
後悔したくありませんし。
translation:
Well, there are also exclusive goods in Okinawa
that you should try.
You don't want to regret not doing so.

japanese:
（確かに五月だったら、
　３段重ねくらい軽く食っちまいそうだが）
translation: (If it were Itsuki, she might go for the triple stack.)

japanese:
（三玖が抹茶好きなのは知ってるが、
　他の奴らは……どうだったか……）
translation:
(I know Miku likes matcha,
 but...I'm not sure about the others...)

japanese:
あっ、待ってください！
ソフトクリームやクレープもあります！
translation: Ah, wait! There's also soft serve and crepes!

japanese:
ううっ！
また選択肢が増えてしまいました。
これは、かなりの難問です。
translation:
Ooohh!
The choices just keep increasing.
This is quite a challenge.

japanese:
クレープなら新鮮な果物も一緒に味わえますね。
では、私はマンゴークレープにアイスをダブルで！
translation:
If you go for a crepe, you can also enjoy fresh fruit.
Then, I'll have a mango crepe
with a double scoop of ice cream!

japanese:
私はカップアイスのトリプルに、
ソフトクリームを追加しておきます。
translation:
I'll have a triple-scoop in a cup,
with soft serve added, please.

japanese:
（これはもう味の好み云々の問題じゃねぇな。
　どっちも頼みすぎだろ……）
translation:
(This is no longer a matter of taste preferences.
 They both ordered way too much...)

japanese: 上杉君はどうしますか？
translation: What are you gonna choose, Uesugi-kun?

japanese: じゃ、この苺のアイスにするか。
translation: Well, I guess I'll go with this strawberry ice cream.

japanese:
ん～、やはり美味しいです！
これは☆３つ確定ですね！
translation: Mmm, it's delicious! I'll give it five stars for sure!

japanese:
それは是非、確認しなければ。
その塩ちんすこう味、ひとくち頂けますか？
translation:
I must definitely confirm that.
May I have a taste of that salted chinsuko?

japanese:
では、替わりにそちらのマンゴークレープを
ひとくち頂きますね？
translation:
In that case,
I'll have a taste of your mango crepe in exchange.

japanese:
（どっちも美味そうに食いやがって。
　まあ実際、普通に美味いが）
translation:
(They both look so delicious.
 Well, they actually taste really good.)

japanese: じー……。
translation: *stare*

japanese: うん？
translation: Hm?

japanese: ……見ててもやらんぞ？
translation: ...Even if you stare, I'm not giving you any.

japanese: べ、別に欲しいなんて思っていません！
translation: I-it's not like I want it or anything!

japanese: ですが苺味も美味しそうですね……。
translation: But, that strawberry flavor looks delicious too...

japanese: そうじっくり見つめられると食いづらいんだが。
translation: It's hard to eat while being stared at like that.

japanese:
やはり気になります。
私も、その苺味のアイスを買ってきますね。
translation:
I'm still curious.
I'm gonna buy that strawberry ice cream as well.

japanese: まだ食うのかよ！？
translation: You're still gonna eat?!

japanese: なんだ、欲しいのか？
translation: What? Want some?

japanese: ど、どうしてわかったんですか！？
translation: H-how could you tell?!

japanese: そりゃ、獲物を狙う目をしてたからな。
translation:
That's because you were looking at the ice cream
like it's prey.

japanese:
……違います。
そんなこと、これっぽちも思っていませんから。
translation:
...That's not true.
I wasn't thinking anything like that at all.

japanese:
……やはり気になります。
私も、その苺味のアイスを買ってきますね。
translation:
...I'm still curious.
I'm gonna buy that strawberry ice cream as well.

japanese: まだ食うのかよ！？
translation: You're still gonna eat?!

japanese: そんなに気になるなら、ひとくち食うか？
translation: If you're so curious, do you want a bite?

japanese: いいのですか！？
translation: Is that alright?!

japanese:
いえ、大丈夫です！
男性のあなたから頂くなど、はしたないですから。
translation:
No, that's alright!
I can't take it from a man like you,
it's too improper.

japanese:
あ……。
そうだな、悪い。
つい、らいはにやる感覚で言っちまった。
translation:
Ah...
Yeah, sorry about that. I just said it
without thinking, like I was teasing you.

japanese: お気持ちだけ、受け取っておきます。
translation: I appreciate the gesture.

japanese:
……やはり気になります。
私も、その苺味のアイスを買ってきますね。
translation:
...I'm still curious.
I'm gonna buy that strawberry ice cream as well.

japanese: まだ食うのかよ！？
translation: You're still gonna eat?!

japanese: あまり食べすぎると、お腹を冷やしますよ？
translation:
If you eat too much,
your stomach will get cold, you know?

japanese: いや、お前がそれを言うか！？
translation: What, why are you lecturing me about that?!

japanese:
（結局、この五月は苺アイスを追加購入して
　もう１人と仲良く分け合って食べていた）
translation:
(In the end, this Itsuki bought some strawberry
 ice cream as well, and shared it
 with the other Itsuki.)

japanese: （２人合わせて、俺の何倍食ったんだろう……）
translation: (I wonder how much more they ate than I did...)
